title: Clayton Dubilier & Rice to Triple Money on $2.5 Billion Sirius Computer Sale to CDW
sub_head: Private-equity firm stands to roughly triple its investment in the technology company, which it backed a little more than two years ago
body:
Information-technology company CDW Corp. said it has agreed to buy Sirius Computer Solutions Inc. for $2.5 billion in cash from private-equity firm Clayton Dubilier & Rice.
The deal stands to produce a gross return of around three times Clayton Dubilierâ€™s initial investment in Sirius, a provider of IT services integration, and funnel around $1.2 billion in proceeds to the fund the firm used to back the company in 2019, according to an investor memo from Clayton Dubilier that was viewed by The Wall Street Journal.
